greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of Sum_{d | n} 1/rad(d).
comment: Let rad(n) be the radical of n, which equals the product of all prime factors of n (A007947). Let g(n) = 1/rad(n) and let f(n) = Sum_{d | n} g(d). This is a multiplicative function whose value on a prime power is f(p^k) = 1 + k/p. Hence f is a weighted divisor-counting function that weights divisors d higher when they have few and small prime divisors themselves. The sequence a(n) lists the numerators of the fractions f(n) in lowest terms.
If p is prime, then a(p^k) = p+k if p does not divide k, 1 + k/p if it does. In particular, a(p^p) = 2. - _Robert Israel_, Jan 25 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Array[Numerator@ DivisorSum[#, 1/Apply[Times, FactorInteger[#][[All, 1]]] &] &, 71] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 19 2019 *)
xref: Cf. A007947 (radical), A322966 (denominators), A008473 (unreduced numerators, i.e., f(n)*rad(n)).
Numbers n where f(n) increases to a record: A322447.
results.author: _David S. Metzler_, Dec 31 2018
